title: Motion to Reject Notice of Opposition to Claim of Exemption (Judgment Levy)
question: Judgment Creditor filed Notice of Opposition to my Claim of Exemption with the Court 15 days after service, which did not comply within the time allowed, pursuant to the California Code of Civil Procedure section 703.550, which specifically states they must file within ten (10) days after service of the notice of the claim of exemption. Can I file a "Motion to Reject their Notice of Opposition"?
answers: You can file an Objection to the Opposition, but you must show that you have been prejudiced. Most judges will accept the late opposition and rule on that basis. You should attend the hearing and bring evidence of your financial hardship.
No, there is no such procedure. You might be able to file a Reply to Opposition, setting forth the untimeliness of the Opposition. But you cannot file a motion to reject the belated opposition.
